author: tersec
content:
> shared that Nimbus canâ€™t currently run consensus-specs release alpha.6 due to an inconsistency with kzg libraries. <@504202741933932544> confirmed Teku had a similar issue which was resolved when the version bump of the kzg library was reverted. <@592004585506340885> will check the issue and create a new release.

ah, to clarify. Nimbus can and does. But it needs the KZG libraries, version 2.1.2. But these libraries might have some other issue. But, and this is the same (I think) point as concerns Teku, it's that a client can't in general pass the alpha.6 tests fully without a column ID ordering which 2.1.2 (but not 2.1.1) enforce. So reverting back to 2.1.1 means skipping some alpha.6 tests
